info.title: AODocs REST API
info.description: The AODocs REST API exposes most of the features of AODocs. It can be used to implement custom applications, third-party integration, bulk tools, or just to experiment with AODocs.

tags.name: user
tags.description: Lets you get information about users and groups (beta version, subject to change)

get.description: Lists the users, groups and roles of the library matching a pattern.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Set additional information to return (each additional item increases the response latency). Available value: EMAIL_QUALIFICATIONS

get.description: Lists the users and groups which are members of the given Google group.

parameters.name: groupEmail
parameters.description: The email address of a group

get.description: Lists the groups either in library role, in a group or in a document's permissions matching a pattern.

parameters.name: inGroup
parameters.description: The Google group to look into

parameters.name: inRole
parameters.description: The role ID to look into (on the selected library)

parameters.name: inDocument
parameters.description: The document ID in which permissions to look into

get.description: Lists the licensed users matching the query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

get.description: Gets user information for the current user.

patch.description: Updates user preferences partially (all non-specified field values will remain unchanged) - only works with editable properties.

get.description: Lists storage accounts a user can use to create a library on a domain

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The email address of a user

get.description: Lists the users and groups either in library role, in a group or in a document's permissions matching a pattern.

parameters.name: inGroup
parameters.description: The Google group to look into

parameters.name: inRole
parameters.description: The role ID to look into (on the selected library)

parameters.name: inDocument
parameters.description: The document ID in which permissions to look into

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Set additional information to return (each additional item increases the response latency). Available value: EMAIL_QUALIFICATIONS

get.description: Lists the users either in library role, in a group or in a document's permissions matching a pattern.

parameters.name: inGroup
parameters.description: The Google group to look into

parameters.name: inRole
parameters.description: The role ID to look into (on the selected library)

parameters.name: inDocument
parameters.description: The document ID in which permissions to look into

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Set additional information to return (each additional item increases the response latency). Available value: EMAIL_QUALIFICATIONS

parameters.name: excludeWhitelistedUsers
parameters.description: Whether we should suggest users only of the domain

get.description: Counts the number of documents that require a workflow transition by the given user, grouped by library, workflow, state (up to 1000 tasks).

parameters.name: countLimit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to count. Defaults to 1000, max 1000.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The email address of a user

get.description: Gets user information for the given user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The email address of a user

get.description: Lists starred entities based on its type for the given user.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The email address of a user

post.description: Stars a entity based on its type and ID for the given user.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The email address of a user

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: ID of the object (only library ID for now)

delete.description: Unstars a entity based on its type and ID for the given user.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The email address of a user

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: ID of the object (only library ID for now)

get.description: Gets information about an email address (Google user, member of the domain, allowlisted...).
Lists domain role information for the current user of the given domain.
Lists role information for the current user of the given library.

allowlisted.description: Whether the email address is allowlisted (individually or via its domain) in the current domain

belongsToDomain.description: Whether the email address is part of the current domain

googleEmailAddress.description: Whether the email address is tied to a Google account

group.description: The email address is a group email

createdAt.description: The timestamp (in ms) at which the catalog value was created (read-only field)

deleted.description: Whether the catalog value should be marked as deleted

id.description: The ID of the reference catalog value

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp (in ms) at which the catalog value was last modified (read-only field)

leaf.description: Whether the value has children values (read-only field)

level.description: The level of the reference catalog value in the hieararchical structure. Level 0 is the first level that has no ancestors (read-only field)

name.description: The name of the reference catalog value

parent.description: The id of the parent of the reference catalog value

parentIds.description: The id's of the ancestors of the reference catalog value (read-only field)

rank.description: Rank of the reference catalog value used for sorting, accepting positive integers only

referenceCatalogId.description: The ID of the reference catalog (read-only field)

privileges.description: The list of privileges coming with the role

type.description: The type of the role (LIBRARY, DOCUMENT, CUSTOM)

allowlisted.description: Whether the email address is allowlisted (individually or via its domain) in the current domain

belongsToDomain.description: Whether the email address is part of the current domain

googleEmailAddress.description: Whether the email address is tied to a Google account

availableStorageServices.description: Attachment storage services available for library creation.

canAccessDrive.description: Whether this user can access Drive

canCreateLibraries.description: Whether this user can creates libraries within this domain

canCreateLibrariesOfTypes.description: The types of library this user can create

googleEmailAddress.description: Whether the email address is tied to a Google account

groupAliases.description: Aliases of the groups this user belongs to.

groups.description: The groups this user belongs to.

impersonable.description: Whether this user can be impersonated

lastEdit.description: The last time the user data has been edited

lastLogin.description: The last time user logged in

locale.description: The preferred locale of the user

superAdmin.description: Whether this user is a super administrator

timezone.description: The preferred timezone of the user

locale.description: The preferred locale of the user

timezone.description: The preferred timezone of the user

combinedPrivileges.description: The combination of the list of privileges granted across all roles the user is involved in

roles.description: The list of roles (and associated privileges) the user is involved in

inDocument_query_parameter.name: inDocument
inDocument_query_parameter.description: The document ID in which permissions to look into

inGroup_query_parameter.name: inGroup
inGroup_query_parameter.description: The Google group to look into

inRole_query_parameter.name: inRole
inRole_query_parameter.description: The role ID to look into (on the selected library)

include_query_parameter.name: include
include_query_parameter.description: Set additional information to return (each additional item increases the response latency). Available value: EMAIL_QUALIFICATIONS

objectId_path_parameter.name: objectId
objectId_path_parameter.description: ID of the object (only library ID for now)

user_path_parameter.name: user
user_path_parameter.description: The email address of a user

user_query_parameter.name: user
user_query_parameter.description: The email address of a user
